title: Snow & Ice Control Strategies
description: Effective strategies, materials, and application practices for winter road maintenance

sections.content: Successful winter road maintenance combines the right strategy, materials, and timing. Understanding when to apply proactive vs. reactive approaches can significantly impact effectiveness and costs.

strategies.description: Apply liquids before or at storm onset to prevent ice bonding to pavement
strategies.timing: Before precipitation begins or at storm onset
limitations: Less effective in freezing rain conditions
strategies.bestFor: Predictable storm conditions with advance notice

strategies.description: Plow first, then apply materials to break existing ice bond and prevent refreeze
strategies.materials: Solid and liquid deicers applied after plowing
process: 2. Apply deicing materials to break bond
4. Repeat plowing and application as needed
benefits: Works on established ice and pack
considerations: Longer time to achieve bare pavement
strategies.bestFor: Emergency response and severe weather events

sections.title: Materials & Temperature Guidelines
sections.overview: Select the right material based on temperature, conditions, and environmental considerations. Temperature effectiveness is the key decision factor.

materials.name: NaCl (Salt)
materials.description: Economical and widely available. The standard choice for general winter maintenance operations.

materials.name: CaCl₂ / MgCl₂
materials.description: Great as pre-wet or for deep cold conditions. Calcium chloride works to -25°F, magnesium chloride to -13°F.

materials.name: CMA/Acetates
materials.description: Lower environmental chloride impact with higher cost. Use where mandated or in sensitive areas.

materials.name: Sand/Grit
materials.description: Traction aid for very cold/unpaved surfaces. Provides mechanical traction, not melting.

sections.title: Application Best Practices
sections.overview: Pre-wet, target lane-mile rates (use ground-speed control), prioritize bridges/grades/curves/intersections, monitor and re-treat strategically.

practices.description: Apply liquids to solids before or during application
points: 8-12 gallons liquid per ton of solid (typical ratio)

practices.description: Use ground-speed control for consistent lane-mile coverage
Treat critical areas first for maximum safety impact
Monitor conditions and time applications strategically
points: Don't salt what you're about to plow off
Allow time for chemical action before plowing
Monitor pavement temperature, not air temperature
Re-treat based on conditions, not schedule

sections.title: Environmental Considerations
sections.overview: Balance operational effectiveness with environmental stewardship through smart material choices and application practices.

mitigation: Consider alternative materials in sensitive areas
Monitor and test nearby water sources
Use less harmful materials where possible
Select less corrosive materials for sensitive areas

sections.title: Strategy Selection Matrix
sections.description: Use these guidelines to select the appropriate strategy and materials for your specific conditions.
